pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [0cc6b2bd73](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17194/commits/0cc6b2bd73548d4875a13d7103f8ff1d43739477)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Module.End.iSup_iInf_maxGenEigenspace_eq_top_of_forall_mapsTo`
`+ _root_.Submodule.inf_iInf_maxGenEigenspace_of_forall_mapsTo`
`+ iInf_maxGenEigenspace_restrict_map_subtype_eq`
`+ inf_iInf`
`+ map_iInf`
`+ mapsTo_restrict_maxGenEigenspace_restrict_of_mapsTo`
`+ restrict_smul_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

> I think we should create a bespoke `Submodule.Invariant` predicate that has the right defeqs, and the things to go between that and `Set.MapsTo`.

Agreed.

:v: ocfnash can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Thanks for the review!
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11134289111/job/30942190005)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11134289111/job/30942189522)

The statements of these lemmas are sufficiently hard to parse at a glance that it would be nice to have docstrings. I'll mark the ones I mean. Other than that:

bors d+

There's a bit of mess created from using `Set.MapsTo` as the condition for invariant subspaces. Indeed, you really *want* it to unfold to `∀ x ∈ p, f x ∈ p`, but it actually unfolds to `∀ x ∈ ↑p, f x ∈ ↑p`, where `↑` is the coercion to `Set`. You can see the annoyance this causes in `mapsTo_restrict_maxGenEigenspace_restrict_of_mapsTo` especially. I'm not going to hold up this PR over it, but I think there are some discrepancies with the way we handle invariant subspaces throughout the library (e.g., `LinearMap.restrict` itself uses `hf : ∀ x ∈ p, f x ∈ q`). I think we should create a bespoke `Submodule.Invariant` predicate that has the right defeqs, and the things to go between that and `Set.MapsTo`.

The statements of these lemmas are sufficiently hard to parse at a glance that it would be nice to have docstrings. I'll mark the ones I mean. Other than that:

bors d+

```suggestion
      (⨅ i, maxGenEigenspace ((f i).restrict (hfp i)) (μ i)).map p.subtype := by
  cases isEmpty_or_nonempty ι
  · simp [iInf_of_isEmpty]
  · simp_rw [inf_iInf, maxGenEigenspace, ((f _).genEigenspace _).mono.directed_le.inf_iSup_eq,
      p.inf_genEigenspace _ (hfp _), ← Submodule.map_iSup, Submodule.map_iInf _ p.injective_subtype]
```
This seems to be a missing `rw` lemma, can you add it?
Done.
This one
and this
and this

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis.InnerProductSpace): Decomposition of finite-dimensional inner product space as direct sum of joint eigenspaces of commuting finite tuples of symmetric operators

nodes.body: There's a bit of mess created from using `Set.MapsTo` as the condition for invariant subspaces. Indeed, you really *want* it to unfold to `∀ x ∈ p, f x ∈ p`, but it actually unfolds to `∀ x ∈ ↑p, f x ∈ ↑p`, where `↑` is the coercion to `Set`. You can see the annoyance this causes in `mapsTo_restrict_maxGenEigenspace_restrict_of_mapsTo` especially. I'm not going to hold up this PR over it, but I think there are some discrepancies with the way we handle invariant subspaces throughout the library (e.g., `LinearMap.restrict` itself uses `hf : ∀ x ∈ p, f x ∈ q`). I think we should create a bespoke `Submodule.Invariant` predicate that has the right defeqs, and the things to go between that and `Set.MapsTo`.

> I think we should create a bespoke `Submodule.Invariant` predicate that has the right defeqs, and the things to go between that and `Set.MapsTo`.

Agreed.

The statements of these lemmas are sufficiently hard to parse at a glance that it would be nice to have docstrings. I'll mark the ones I mean. Other than that:

bors d+
